page.title: 13IRON ORE
page.content: The first excavations of Iron Ore in the Wigpool area were made by the Romans especially from 250 A.D. to 360 A.D.was of the surface type Scowles but they went down to a depth of over 250 ft.passing through layers of iron ore bearing limestone and coal.They iron ore was transported to the largest iron-smelting site in Britain at Ariconium via Hope Mansel.In later times two Iron Pits were sunk.No.1.Pit was 530 feet deep whereas No.2.Pit was 380 feet.This was the tip of a 12 Miles by 5 Miles bent small finger like seam that was to produce over 1 Million tons of Iron ore.That is why we have many isolated cottages in the vicinity.They were the homes of iron miners. From the Bailey side and worked until 1921 when the roof supporting a massive lake was broken and the level in the wells above fell.
